alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Fayette (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 03 at 11:58PM CDT until June 04 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT SUNDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN BASTROP AND SOUTHWESTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 1158 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing light rain across the warned area. Earlier heavy rains up to 4.5 inches of rain will maintain flash flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1/4 inch are possible in the warned area. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... La Grange, Smithville, Flatonia, Muldoon, Cistern, Rosanky, Circle D-KC Estates, Upton, Kovar, Kirtley, Togo, West Point, Floy, Colony, Buescher State Park, Winchester, Elm Grove, Plum, Alum Creek and O`Quinn. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
